back_cards.definition_en: Used to specify a particular noun known to the speaker and listener.
back_cards.example_en: The cat slept on the windowsill.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a unique or specific item.
back_cards.example_en: The moon glowed brightly last night.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a group or class collectively.
back_cards.example_en: The students worked hard on the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Used before a superlative to indicate the highest degree.
back_cards.example_en: He is the fastest runner in the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to something previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: I saw a movie; the movie was thrilling.

back_cards.definition_en: To exist or occur.
back_cards.example_en: A new park will be built next year.

back_cards.definition_en: To act as a linking verb connecting the subject to its complement.
back_cards.example_en: She is a talented musician.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate a state or condition.
back_cards.example_en: The room was quiet during the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in continuous tenses to show ongoing action.
back_cards.example_en: They are studying for the exam.

back_cards.definition_en: To represent identity or equivalence.
back_cards.example_en: This is the best coffee shop in town.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to connect words, phrases, or clauses of equal importance.
back_cards.example_en: I like coffee and tea.

back_cards.definition_en: Joins two actions or events occurring together.
back_cards.example_en: She sang and danced at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Adds additional information or items.
back_cards.example_en: The store sells fruits, vegetables, and bread.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a consequence or result.
back_cards.example_en: He tripped and fell on the sidewalk.

back_cards.definition_en: Connects ideas in a narrative.
back_cards.example_en: We hiked up the hill and enjoyed the view.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce a singular, non-specific noun.
back_cards.example_en: I saw a bird in the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to one of many possible items.
back_cards.example_en: She bought a new laptop yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: Introduces a noun for the first time.
back_cards.example_en: A stranger knocked on the door.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in expressions of quantity or extent.
back_cards.example_en: He runs a mile every morning.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates membership in a general group.
back_cards.example_en: A teacher must be patient.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates possession or belonging.
back_cards.example_en: The keys of the car are on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows a relationship between a part and a whole.
back_cards.example_en: She ate a slice of pizza.

back_cards.definition_en: Specifies the material or content.
back_cards.example_en: The house is made of wood.

back_cards.definition_en: Denotes origin or source.
back_cards.example_en: He is a citizen of Canada.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express association or connection.
back_cards.example_en: The CEO of the company gave a speech.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates direction or destination.
back_cards.example_en: We walked to the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows the recipient of an action.
back_cards.example_en: She gave a gift to her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: Marks the infinitive form of a verb.
back_cards.example_en: He wants to learn coding.

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses a limit or extent.
back_cards.example_en: The score was close, 5 to 4.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates purpose or intention.
back_cards.example_en: I went to the store to buy milk.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates location within a space.
back_cards.example_en: The book is in the bag.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a period of time.
back_cards.example_en: We met in July.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows involvement in an activity.
back_cards.example_en: She works in marketing.

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses a state or condition.
back_cards.example_en: He is in a good mood today.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates the means or medium.
back_cards.example_en: They wrote the letter in blue ink.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker or writer.
back_cards.example_en: I am going to the store.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express personal opinion.
back_cards.example_en: I think this movie is great.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates personal action or experience.
back_cards.example_en: I fell while hiking yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in self-introduction.
back_cards.example_en: I am a software engineer.

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses personal preference.
back_cards.example_en: I prefer tea over coffee.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the person being addressed.
back_cards.example_en: You should try this new restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in giving instructions.
back_cards.example_en: You need to turn left at the light.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to people in general.
back_cards.example_en: You can learn a lot from books.

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses a direct question.
back_cards.example_en: Are you coming to the party?

back_cards.definition_en: Used in casual conversation.
back_cards.example_en: You know, it’s a beautiful day.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a non-human object or animal.
back_cards.example_en: The chair is old, but it is sturdy.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a situation or event.
back_cards.example_en: It rained all afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: Acts as a placeholder subject.
back_cards.example_en: It is important to stay hydrated.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: I saw a movie; it was exciting.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in expressions of time or weather.
back_cards.example_en: It is five o’clock now.

back_cards.definition_en: To possess or own something.
back_cards.example_en: I have a new phone.

back_cards.definition_en: To experience or undergo something.
back_cards.example_en: She had a great time at the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to form perfect tenses.
back_cards.example_en: They have just finished lunch.

back_cards.definition_en: To be obliged to do something.
back_cards.example_en: You have to submit the report by Friday.
He had a letter from his friend.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific thing or person previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: I read the book that you recommended.

back_cards.definition_en: Introduces a defining clause.
back_cards.example_en: The car that broke down was old.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to indicate a reason or cause.
back_cards.example_en: She was upset that the meeting was canceled.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific time or event.
back_cards.example_en: I remember the day that we met.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for emphasis or to point to something specific.
back_cards.example_en: That is the best idea yet.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates purpose or reason.
back_cards.example_en: She bought flowers for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows duration of time.
back_cards.example_en: He worked for three hours.

back_cards.definition_en: Denotes the recipient or beneficiary.
back_cards.example_en: This gift is for you.

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses support or favor.
back_cards.example_en: I’m voting for the new policy.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a destination or goal.
back_cards.example_en: They are headed for the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform an action or task.
back_cards.example_en: I do my homework every evening.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for emphasis in a statement.
back_cards.example_en: You do look tired today.

back_cards.definition_en: Acts as an auxiliary verb in questions.
back_cards.example_en: Do you like to swim?

back_cards.definition_en: Substitutes for another verb to avoid repetition.
back_cards.example_en: She sings better than I do.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates completion of an activity.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s do the dishes now.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a male person previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: John is late; he missed the bus.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a person’s role or job.
back_cards.example_en: He is the manager of the store.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a male in a narrative.
back_cards.example_en: He climbed the mountain alone.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in a general or hypothetical sense.
back_cards.example_en: If a student studies, he will succeed.

back_cards.definition_en: Identifies a male in conversation.
back_cards.example_en: He said he’ll meet us at six.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates accompaniment.
back_cards.example_en: She went to the movie with her friends.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows the means or tool used.
back_cards.example_en: He wrote the note with a pen.

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses association or relationship.
back_cards.example_en: I work with a great team.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates the manner of an action.
back_cards.example_en: She spoke with confidence.

back_cards.definition_en: Denotes possession of a quality or object.
back_cards.example_en: The man with the hat is my uncle.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates position above and in contact with a surface.
back_cards.example_en: The book is on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific day or time.
back_cards.example_en: We meet on Fridays.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows the topic or subject.
back_cards.example_en: She gave a talk on biology.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates dependence or basis.
back_cards.example_en: The decision depends on the budget.

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses attachment or connection.
back_cards.example_en: The lamp is on the wall.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something near the speaker.
back_cards.example_en: This chair is comfortable.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to something being introduced.
back_cards.example_en: This is my new phone.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific moment or situation.
back_cards.example_en: This morning was very cold.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for emphasis on a particular item.
back_cards.example_en: This recipe is the best.

back_cards.definition_en: Identifies something in a narrative.
back_cards.example_en: This story made me laugh.

back_cards.definition_en: Contraction of 'not' used with auxiliary verbs to form negatives.
back_cards.example_en: I don’t like spicy food.

back_cards.definition_en: Negates a verb in informal speech.
back_cards.example_en: She can’t come to the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to deny a statement or action.
back_cards.example_en: He didn’t finish his homework.

back_cards.definition_en: Forms negative questions.
back_cards.example_en: Why aren’t you ready yet?

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses prohibition or refusal.
back_cards.example_en: You shouldn’t run in the hall.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker and others.
back_cards.example_en: We are going to the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express a collective opinion.
back_cards.example_en: We think the plan will work.

back_cards.definition_en: Includes the speaker in a group action.
back_cards.example_en: We finished the project early.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a team or organization.
back_cards.example_en: We won the championship last year.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in general statements including the audience.
back_cards.example_en: We all want a better future.
